Description: Body sherd of Laconian black-figured pottery kylix; dull cream slip; interior: around tondo, black line and frieze of pomegranates; black-figure decoration consisting of part of warrior's helmet with high crest in added red; exterior: part of horizontal handle palmette above broad band with added red, framed by two and three lines; below, frieze of rays.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.526.j and 1888,0601.526.l. This sherd has been attributed to the Hephaistos Painter, who has been renamed the Boreads Painter (Lane 1933-1934, 131, no 12). The kylix has also been attributed to the Arkesilas Painter (Shefton 1954, 300, no. 9).
The simple pomegranate pattern around the tondo is particular to the Boreads Painter.
